item.title: Malami's Denial: Another Round in Nigeria's Anti-Corruption Battle?
item.description:
This episode delves into former AGF Abubakar Malami's dismissal of EFCC allegations as 'baseless and illogical'. We analyze the implications of such high-profile denials for Nigeria's anti-corruption efforts, public trust, and the effectiveness of institutions like the EFCC, questioning the persistent lack of conclusive outcomes.
Hosts: Host: Samjay
Category: Law & Society

item.title: When Resignation Becomes a Battle: The Navy vs. Constitutional Rights
item.description:
This episode delves into the National Industrial Court's landmark ruling affirming a Nigerian Navy officer's right to resign. We discuss the implications of the Navy's attempt to block the resignation, the court's strong condemnation, and what this means for individual liberties within public service in Nigeria.
Hosts: Host: Kore, Co-Host: HypeMan (Naija)
Category: Law & Society
